title: Teen kills boy in accidental shooting: DA
content:
A 17-year-old boy has been charged following what appears to be an accidental shooting that left a 15-year-old boy dead in Lancaster County Friday morning.
The shooting occurred at the unidentified 17-year-old's home on West Main Street in Mountville, where police responded to a 911 call at 10:45 a.m., according to the Lancaster County district attorney's office. The 15-year-old died of a single gunshot wound.
An investigation continues, but nothing suggests the shooting was intentional, the DA's office said. The two boys were looking at the gun, stolen from a vehicle in the township, before it fired, according to the DA's office.
The 17-year-old was charged with misdemeanor counts of involuntary manslaughter, theft from a vehicle, possession of drug paraphernalia and felony theft of a firearm.
The 17-year-old will be prosecuted in juvenile court.
A person charged with involuntary manslaughter cannot be charged and prosecuted as an adult under the Juvenile Act, according to the DA's office.
